definition.en: A legal document giving official permission to do something with a resource.
rdfs:Literal encoded using the relevant ISO 8601 Date and Time compliant string and typed using the appropriate XML Schema datatype (xsd:gYear, xsd:gYearMonth, xsd:date, or xsd:dateTime).

decimal represents a subset of the real numbers, which can be represented by decimal numerals. The ·value space· of decimal is the set of numbers that can be obtained by multiplying an integer by a non-positive power of ten, i.e., expressible as i × 10^-n where i and n are integers and n >= 0.

duration represents a duration of time. The ·value space· of duration is a six-dimensional space where the coordinates designate the Gregorian year, month, day, hour, minute, and second components defined in § 5.5.3.2 of [ISO 8601], respectively.
Hex-encoded binary data. The ·value space· of hexBinary is the set of finite-length sequences of binary octets.
A temporal entity with zero extent or duration
A catalogue or repository that hosts the Datasets or Data Services being described.
A description of a Datasets entry in the Catalogue.
A collection of operations that provides access to one or more datasets or data processing functions.
A conceptual entity that represents the information published.
A physical embodiment of the Dataset in a particular format.
Resource published or curated by a single agent.

usage.en: For DCAT-AP, the class is considered an abstract notion.

definition.en: An activity is something that occurs over a period of time and acts upon or with entities; it may include consuming, processing, transforming, modifying, relocating, using, or generating entities.
Any entity carrying out actions with respect to the (Core) entities Catalogue, Datasets, Data Services and Distributions.

usage.en: If the Agent is an organisation, the use of the Organization Ontology14 is recommended.

definition.en: A link to the Dataset, Data service or Catalog described in the record.

usage.en: A catalogue record will refer to one entity in a catalogue. This can be either a Dataset or a Data Service. To ensure an unambigous reading of the cardinality the range is set to Catalogued Resource. However it is not the intend with this range to require the explicit use of the class Catalogued Record. As abstract class, an subclass should be used.

definition.en: A name of the agent.

usage.en: This property can be repeated for different versions of the name (e.g. the name in different languages)

definition.en: A site or end-point (Data Service) that is listed in the Catalogue.

usage.en: As empty Catalogues are usually indications of problems, this property should be combined with the previous property dataset to implement an empty Catalogue check.

definition.en: This property refers to a collection of data that this data service can distribute.
A Catalogue Record that is part of the Catalogue
The root location or primary endpoint of the service (an IRI).
A description of the services available via the end-points, including their operations, parameters etc.

usage.en: The property gives specific details of the actual endpoint instances, while dct:conformsTo is used to indicate the general standard or specification that the endpoints implement.

definition.en: An available Distribution for the Dataset.
A Dataset that is part of the Catalogue.

usage.en: As empty Catalogues are usually indications of problems, this property should be combined with the next property service to implement an empty Catalogue check.

definition.en: Contact information that can be used for sending comments about the Dataset.
A URL that gives access to a Distribution of the Dataset.

usage.en: The resource at the access URL may contain information about how to get the Dataset.

definition.en: A data service that gives access to the distribution of the dataset
A sample distribution of the dataset
A secondary identifier of the Dataset, such as MAST/ADS17, DataCite18, DOI19, EZID20 or W3ID21.
A type of the agent that makes the Catalogue or Dataset available
A type of the Dataset.

usage.en: A recommended controlled vocabulary data-type is foreseen.

definition.en: A type of licence, e.g. indicating public domain or royalties required.
A name given to the Data Service.

usage.en: This property can be repeated for parallel language versions of the name.

definition.en: An entity (organisation) responsible for making the Catalogue available.
An entity (organisation) responsible for making the Dataset available.
A licence under which the Catalogue can be used or reused.
A licence under which the Distribution is made available.
A licence under which the Data service is made available.
The structure that can be returned by querying the endpointURL.
A free-text account of the Data Service.

usage.en: This property can be repeated for parallel language versions of the description.

definition.en: An established schema to which the described Distribution conforms.
An implementing rule or other specification.
Information that indicates whether the Dataset is open data, has access restrictions or is not public.
Information regarding access or restrictions based on privacy, security, or other policies.
